snippet: Responding to a surge in the homeless population, New York City has rapidly opened nine shelters in the last two months, and local officials say they were blindsided.
abstract: Bloomberg administration is forced to open more shelters as the homeless population in New York City jumps sharply over the past year, causing a record number of people to enter the shelter system; administration says the increase stems in part from the end of the city's main rent-subsidy program for homeless families; new shelters have provoked criticism from local officials who say they were blindsided by the decision to open them.
lead_paragraph: Responding to a surge in the homeless population, New York City has rapidly opened nine shelters in the last two months, and local officials say they were blindsided.

headline.seo: N.Y.C. Homeless Shelters in Record Demand; New Facilities Planned
headline.main: New York Acts Quickly Amid Sharp Rise in Homelessness
headline.print_headline: Homelessness Rises Sharply; City Acts Fast
